name: World's Largest Peanut Butter Cup
description: This is the best peanut butter pie out there! You make this and your family will beg for more! It is a bit time-consuming to make, but well worth it!
recipeIngredient: 1 cup whipped topping (such as Cool Whip®)
1 (3.4 ounce) package instant French vanilla pudding mix
1 (3.9 ounce) package instant chocolate pudding mix
1 cup whipped topping (such as Cool Whip®), or more as needed
3 (2 ounce) bars milk chocolate candy bar, shaved
¼ cup crushed peanuts, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
Press pie crust dough into the bottom of a 9-inch pie pan. Prick sides and bottom of dough with a fork.
Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, 10 to 12 minutes. Cool completely.

Beat cream cheese, peanut butter, and confectioners' sugar together in a bowl until smooth. Fold 1 cup whipped topping into cream cheese mixture. Spread into cooled pie crust. Chill in refrigerator until set, 1 hour.

Mix vanilla pudding mix and chocolate pudding mix with milk in a bowl until pudding starts to set up, about 2 minutes; spread over cream cheese mixture in pie crust. Spread 1 cup whipped topping over the pie. Sprinkle with shaved chocolate and peanuts. Chill in refrigerator before serving, about 1 hour.

review.reviewBody: This was an easy pie to make. It was a very good balance between chocolate and peanut butter not too sweet just enough. I liked the light and creamy texture. The pie also looked very professional. My 14 year old daughter had no problem making this recipe.

Yummy! My whole family really enjoyed this pie. I used a large box of chocolate pudding instead of a small box of vanilla and chocolate (since I didn't have the small boxes). I also didn't use nearly the full amount of chocolate and peanuts for the topping - just enough for a light coating. Creamy just the right amount of sweet and delicious!

I normally don't like changing recipes even the slightest bit but when I made this I was only using stuff I had on hand. First off I used a pre-made store brand 10 inch graham cracker crust but the pie was still near overflowing so no problems there. Second I'm very impatient when it comes to cooking so my mom taught me this trick where for every hour something needs to sit in the refrigerator you can put it in the freezer for ten minutes instead. It doesn't always work but thankfully it did for this recipe. Lastly in the filling I had to use some crunchy peanut butter along with creamy but it didn't change much. Also I replaced the chocolate shavings with mini chocolate chips and I didn't have any peanuts to use so I left those out. Overall no major changes and it turned out well just make sure your whipped topping is softened before spreading it on top or you'll mess up the layers. It tastes wonderful I love the taste of each layer.
